See the index for user/developer documentation. The following items describe the implementation of Python-on-a-chip (abbreviated p14p).

The p14p impelementation consists of several essential components which combine to form a working subset of the Python language:

  • The virtual machine, which executes the bytecode which composes a Python program.
  • A set of standard libraries, which implement essential features of the langauge.
  • A port, which enables the virtual machine to execute on a specific microprocessor.
  • Supporting tools used to produce bytecode and interact with a working p14p implementation.

Virtual Machine

Standard Libraries

Ports

Several ports, listed below, enable use of p14p on specific microprocessors. All ports reside in the src/platform directory.
  • The AVR port provides read/write access to PORTA only.
  • The PIC24 and dsPIC33 processor port provides digital I/O, Analog input, and PWM outputs.
